availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses W. Woosley (Christian Co., KY, farmer and pvt 3 KY Cav)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer. Christian County, Kentucky, native. Son of James T. Woosley and Ruth Woosley. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Christian County in 1860. Served in 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 15, 1861, to April 1865. Captured near Sacramento on December 28, 1861, and imprisoned at Camp Chase, Ohio, until February 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 469A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 756-57.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, p. 302.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 474.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 64.
